alert.note: Alert for Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:03PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rooks County through 145 PM CDT... At 102 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Wakeeney, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palco, and rural areas of far southwestern Rooks County. It currently appears the most intense portion of this storm will slide just south and southwest of Rooks County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for north central Kansas.
